page.title: 10AN ABBATTOIR IN CROSSGATES
page.content: In Crossgates there is a{slaughter {house.}Mr.Green our local butcher at the abbattoir, prefers to buy, kill and prepare his own meat. It is not only cheaper and more convenient but far more satisfying because he has complete control of the meat from the {"hoof to the shop".}He also hangs the meat traditionally until mature, thereby enhancing its taste and quality. There is a lot of paper work involved at the abbattoir, a record has to be kept of all the animals that are killed and regular vetinary inspections are also required. Every time an animal is slaughtered the local meat inspector must stamp the carcus before allowing it to go into the shops. Due to the butchers personal involvement with the animals the quality of his meat is excellent.
